verses.roman:
cāhiyā nā pāila kukkura, loka saba āilā
duḥkhī hañā śivānanda upavāsa kailā

synonyms: cāhiyā—looking; nā—not; pāila—found; kukkura—the dog; loka saba āilā—all the men returned; duḥkhī hañā—being unhappy; śivānanda—Śivānanda Sena; upavāsa—fast; kailā—observed.
translation: When the men returned without success, Śivānanda Sena became very unhappy and fasted for the night.
